category: THE FOUNDATION GROUP: DRIVE THE STRATEGY
subcategory: Lack of ownership of DEI mission/vision statement by the majority of stakeholders
description: This refers to a situation where the majority of stakeholders in an organization do not feel a sense of personal investment or responsibility towards the organization's DEI mission and vision statement.

content.text: DEI is used as a mere representation, with more emphasis placed on its depiction than its actual execution.
The executives fail to understand the importance of DEI as no particular tools are available to measure its impact.
The organizational culture does not support the DEI vision and mission statements.
The people leaders are not aware of, or do not give importance to, the DEI vision/mission statements.
Resources are not allocated to support the DEI vision and mission statements.
An act addressing diversity and inclusion is necessary, as the underlying framework must be exceptionally robust.
It is essential to work on men's mindset to foster an inclusive, innovative, and harmonious workplace for all individuals.
It is necessary to organize regular training sessions and workshops for employees to educate them on the benefits of DEI and its importance in creating a positive organizational culture.
Senior leaders should set an example by setting DEI targets for themselves and their teams to influence broad organizational change.
Teams or individuals who achieve DEI targets must be rewarded and recognized.
It is imperative to incorporate DEI metrics into performance evaluations and appraisals, just like profits and sales.
A specific budget must be allocated to an organizationâ€™s DEI initiatives, which can be a game-changer in the dynamic business environment where the importance of DEI is growing significantly.
